isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - REMOVE AXLE AND BEAMS ASSEMBLY (COMPLETE SUSPENSION OVERHAUL)

svcsubsec.title: REMOVE AXLE AND BEAMS ASSEMBLY (COMPLETE SUSPENSION OVERHAUL)

note.para: When a major overhaul is required, remove the complete tandem unit from the frame. However, if it is required, you may remove the torque rods, load cushions, beams and other components separately.

step1.para: Cage the spring (PARKING) brake. Refer to GROUP 04-AIR BRAKES in the CTS- 5000 Master Service Manual.
Drain the vehicle air system and disconnect all air lines leading to the rear axles. Mark the air lines for later assembly reference.
Disconnect the drive shaft from the front of the forward drive axle. Refer to GROUP 06-PROPELLER SHAFT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Disconnect torque rods from the axle housing.
Remove the saddle cap locknuts, washers and saddle caps.
Raise and support the vehicle frame high enough to roll the axles (with the beams attached) out from under the vehicle ( Figure 23). When axle assembly is removed, block front/rear wheels.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Raised Frame for Axle Removal

caution.para: Upon removal of the axle assembly, support the vehicle frame on stands that are strong enough to hold the vehicle and to withstand the movement caused by disassembly of the suspension system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or damage to equipment, block the axle assemblies securely so the beam ends are not free to roll or pivot.

step1.para: Replace the locknuts on the saddle cap studs to protect threads ( Figure 23).
Remove the saddle-and-leaf-spring or cushion assemblies.
Remove the spring brackets from the frame.
